s.text: The WP notes that in contrast to the 453-page report Starr served up in September, the day's discussions were distinctly "G-rated."
The paper says that to keep the Dems from using the material during the hearings yesterday, Henry Hyde declared it confidential.
On the other hand, a sign of how much money is washing around this country is on full display in USAT 's front-pager on expensive toys.

The list includes: When the financial markets yawn in the face of bad news, when yields on emerging market bonds go down, when inflation jitters return, when commodity prices rise, when emerging nations start importing more, and when Japan's economy starts to expand again.

The LAT alone highlights Starr's sole concession in the face of all this: that perhaps when requesting from Janet Reno expansion of his charge into Jones-related matters, he should have informed her of the discussions he'd previously had with Jones' lawyers.

Meanwhile, for real Lewinsky spontaneity, you had to be in Japan with the president, where, the papers all report, during a "town meeting," Bill Clinton was asked by an Osaka housewife how he apologized to his wife and daughter for his affair.
